prompt: <description>**Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.5178, 0.0] Next, draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. The sketch should consist of a single face, face\\_1. On face\\_1, draw a loop, loop\\_1, using four lines: - line\\_1: Start Point=[0.0, 0.0], End Point=[0.75, 0.0] - line\\_2: Start Point=[0.75, 0.0], End Point=[0.75, 0.4692] - line\\_3: Start Point=[0.75, 0.4692], End Point=[0.0, 0.4692] - line\\_4: Start Point=[0.0, 0.4692], End Point=[0.0, 0.0] Close the loop to form a rectangular shape. The dimensions of the prism will be 3 units by 4 units by 5 units. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following euler angles and translation vector: - Euler Angles: same as the coordinate system (0.0, 0.0, -90.0) - Translation Vector: same as the coordinate system (0.0, 0.5178, 0.0) Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction by 0.3745 units. This will create the 3D model of the rectangular prism. **Part 2: Construct a cylindrical object with a slightly tapered top and bottom** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.1877, 0.1433, 0.0649] Next, draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. The sketch should consist of two concentric circles, circle\\_1 in loops: - loop\\_1: circle\\_1 with a radius of 0.1756 units - loop\\_2: circle\\_1 with a radius of 0.1327 units Close the loops to form a cylindrical shape. The cylindrical object will have a slightly tapered top and bottom due to the change in scale between the loops. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.3511. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following euler angles and translation vector: - Euler Angles: same as the coordinate system (0.0, 0.0, -90.0) - Translation Vector: same as the coordinate system (0.1877, 0.1433, 0.0649) Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction by 0.1433 units. This will create the 3D model of the cylindrical object. The final CAD model will be a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center, positioned at a 45-degree angle.</description>
